events.description: Brent Scowcroft ran a lean and efficient organization, allowing direct communication with him and Bob Gates. Meetings were arranged quickly, and staff work involved concise briefing memos.
supporting_quotes: Scowcroft ran an extraordinarily lean and efficient organization. There was a minimum of layering. We could e-mail General Scowcroft or Bob Gates directly.

For example, when (Israeli Prime Minister) Rabin, who was then in the opposition came to town, it took a quick email to Scowcroft’s secretary, a meeting was scheduled and then you’d follow up with another longer email as a briefing memo in which you always started with what the general sought to achieve in that meeting.

events.description: Brent Scowcroft communicated with Ambassador Robert Strauss during the August Coup of 1991, instructing him to come to the White House the next day on the President's behalf.
supporting_quotes: It was Brent Scowcroft who said the President wants you to come in tomorrow.
It was Brent Scowcroft who said the President wants you to come in tomorrow, and stop
National Security Advisor Brent Scowcroft and Secretary of State James Baker
Brent Scowcroft had a world of experience and sophistication.
General Brent Scowcroft, who was the head of the National Security Council

events.role: Advisor to the President and communication link between the President and NSC staff as well as other agencies of government
events.description: Brent Scowcroft served as an 'honest broker' at the NSC, accurately and fairly presenting the views of departments and agencies. He had the confidence of President Gerald Ford and Henry Kissinger.
supporting_quotes: Scowcroft came in and became what is called an ‘honest broker’ at the NSC . . . He was always seen as one who accurately and fairly presented the views of departments and agencies.

Brent had enormous influence. He had the absolute confidence of the President, Jerry Ford, as well as Henry Kissinger. . . Brent was not there to manage the staff. There were other people who managed staff. Brent was there to be an advisor to the President and a communication link between the President and NSC staff as well as other agencies of government. He did that job superbly.

events.description: Scowcroft was the person who saw the President most often and accurately presented the views of departments and agencies.
supporting_quotes: Scowcroft came in and became what is called an “honest broker” at the NSC. He was the person who saw the President most often, but he was always seen as one who accurately and fairly presented the views of departments and agencies.
